channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2387] Facebook Suggestions Are Getting Out of Hand
[+2356] You'll probably only see this in the U.S. [PIC]
item.description: And... wtf is squirrel corn (pardon my ignorance)?

item.title: [+1523] Merry Sithmas!
[+1428] USDA Classifies PETA as Terrorists
item.description: The group's contentious media campaigns, undercover operations, infamous advertising, and high profile demonstrations have made them perhaps the most infamous--and most polarizing--nonprofit organization there is. But are they terrorists? According to the US Department of Agriculture, yes, yes they are.

item.title: [+1301] WTF?! Chinese TV Creates CGI Tiger Woods Reenactment (Video)
item.description: Reportedly produced for Chinese television, a hypothetical CGI "reenactment" of the alleged late-night dispute between Tiger Woods and his wife, Elin Nordegren, is drawing bemused and perplexed reactions from U.S. bloggers.

item.title: [+1226] New Super Mario Bros. Wii Running At 1080p [Vid]
item.description: So this guy on YouTube has some gameplay of New Super Mario Bros. Wii running through a PC emulator called Dolphin. The footage has some obvious audio hiccups and the video freezes at 1:10 until 1:18. Beautiful nonetheless.

item.title: [+1195] MS Internet Explorer finally dethroned in Germany!
item.description: For the first time since 1996, the InternetExplorer browser family is no longer dominating the German Internet landscape. 4 slides that show the development of browser marketshare and how the impact of new IE versions got weaker by every version.

item.title: [+1124] xkcd - Spinal Tap Amps
[+935] Sprint fed customer GPS data to cops over 8 million times
item.description: A blogger has released audio of Sprint's Electronic Surveillance Manager describing the carrier's cooperation with law enforcement. Among the revelations are that Sprint has so far filled over 8 million requests from LEOs for customer GPS data.

item.title: [+920] More Insane Fearmongering From The Family Reserach Council
item.description: In a four-page solicitation letter mailed to supporters this month the conservative organization went even further in its rhetoric, claiming that President Obama wants to “impose homosexuality and silence Christianity in workplaces”

item.title: [+851] D’oh Re Mi [Pic]
[+826] Medal of Honor winner, 90, ordered to remove flagpole
item.description: Col. Van T. Barfoot, one of the country's last-surviving Medal of Honor winners, is under the gun from his Henrico County community's homeowner association for erecting a flagpole in his front yard.

item.title: [+760] AT&T Comes in Last in Consumer Reports Study That Surprises
item.description: Here is some news anyone with an iPhone could have told you: AT&T delivers crappy service that its customers hate. But this news comes from a reputable source, Consumer Reports, instead of the usual whiny friends.

item.title: [+701] 8 Lives That Were Ruined by Facebook
item.description: Michaele Salahi didn't hesitate to post snapshots of her White House gatecrashing on Facebook, but perhaps she should have. According to the New York Daily News, many of Salahi’s 11,914-and-counting "fans" have rained insults on the "Desperate Housewives of D.C." hopeful, calling her a "fame whore," a "gold digger," and a "silly, old cow."

item.title: [+673] Brothers living in cave inherit billions from lost grandma
item.description: Two penniless brothers who live in a cave outside Budapest are to inherit most of a reported £4 billion after an astonishing twist in their family fortunes.

item.title: [+671] It Was a Miracle...
[+667] A Crushing Legacy of Bush
item.description: From now on, the headlines about Afghanistan will be slugged "Obama's War," and perhaps that is fair enough given the president's many endorsements of what he has called a war of necessity. It would be much less fair, however, to ignore the events that led us to this moment.

item.title: [+631] Comcast Buys NBC From GE
item.description: Comcast's acquisition of NBC from GE is a done deal reports David Faber on CNBC. All that needs to be done is paper work at this point. The deal should be announced Thursday morning, says Faber.

item.title: [+624] Chuck Norris Calls Climate Change a "Con Game." No Joke.
item.description: In a recent appearance on Fox News, Norris warned that if the US signs on to a successor to the Kyoto Protocol, "Our country as we know it now will no longer exist."

item.title: [+620] Mothers Against Nickelodeon: No more boogers & fart jokes!
item.description: Their campaign ventures beyond commercials to actual children's programming. To wit: "Lazy Town, a show on Nick Jr. and Noggin, where a young girl hangs out with a 30-year-old man by herself all day long," warns the website. "He's 'her friend.' They sing and dance. He wakes her up in the morning. She wears skimpy little dresses."
